page.title: 06Entertainment.
page.content: During the 1920s there were 5 cinemas in Ashington.There were also several dance halls and theatres.By the late 1970s only two remained and by 1983 they had both been closed down.Fruit machines and a snack bar have replaced The Wallaw and the empty shell of the other is used as a warehouse.As far as modern entertainment in Ashington goes there are several pubs and a leisure centre.There is also a cricket club,a rugby club and a football club.The pavillion is still open but is only used as a bingo hall.You may think that there is ample entertainment in Ashington but most of the things I have mentioned are only for older people.There is very little on offer for the younger generation.
